modules.description: Provides operations to configure and advance a numerical integration process, including setting tolerances, step sizes, and stop times, and to compute solution values at intermediate points. Works with custom vector types `nvec` and functions for right-hand side evaluations and solution interpolation. Used to control and query the state of a solver during time-dependent simulations.

Processes a float value and a callback function, triggering the callback after a discrete time interval. Operates with floating-point numbers and function closures. Used to schedule delayed execution of actions in real-time systems.

Provides functions for parsing, transforming, and simulating hybrid systems that combine discrete and continuous behaviors, including ODE solving and event detection. Works with abstract syntax trees, signal networks, and differential equations represented as OCaml data structures. Used to model and simulate control systems where software logic interacts with physical processes, such as in embedded systems or real-time simulations.

manages time-stepping and event scheduling in simulations, combining numerical integration control with timed callback execution. It handles `nvec` vectors and float-based time intervals, supporting operations like setting solver parameters, querying solution states, and scheduling function calls. Users can adjust integration tolerances, interpolate solutions, and trigger actions at specific times. This enables precise control over dynamic systems and real-time event handling.

This module provides functions for defining signal configurations and organizing scoped visual elements, operating on tuples of labels, signal types, and amplitudes, as well as polymorphic record types representing scoped or windowed contexts. It enables the creation of structured plot layouts through windowing operations and supports nested environment management in systems requiring contextual isolation. Use cases include data visualization pipelines and interactive interface design where hierarchical or modular scope arrangements are necessary.

Provides access to the main application window and handles input events such as key presses and mouse movements. Operates on graphical window objects and event records. Used to capture user interactions for real-time game control and interface responses.

Provides functions to define and manipulate signal types such as points, piecewise, square, and linear, and to construct signal objects from these types. Processes lists of signals and values to update display elements, and creates scoped visualization windows with adjustable ticks. Used to generate and dynamically update graphical representations of data sequences in real-time applications.
